intro: Chenopodium variegatum, commonly known as variegated goosefoot, is a flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is native to the eastern United States and is characterized by its succulent, lobed leaves that often display a striking variegation of green, white, and pink. The plant produces small, greenish flowers in clusters, which are typically wind-pollinated. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and disturbed areas. Chenopodium variegatum is an annual herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various insects.
